intro: Licania durifolia, commonly known as the hard-leaved licania, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its woody structure and persistent leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are thick and leathery, providing a distinctive appearance, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Licania durifolia is adapted to humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
